DOC.brief_summary: We examine effect short-term ( 2-wk ) consumption HF- HG-sweetened beverage adolescent ( 15-20 yr age ) insulin sensitivity , insulin secretion , insulin clearance , triacylglycerol ( TAG ) , cholesterol concentration .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Sugar Sweetened Beverage Metabolic Health Male Female Adolescents
DOC.detailed_description: This counterbalance study consist two trial include 1 ) high fructose ( HF ) trial , 2 ) high glucose ( HG ) trial . Each trial blind participant , perform random order , 15 length . During day 1-14 trial , participant consume either 710 ml per day HF-sweetened beverage ( sweeten 50 g fructose 15 g glucose ) 2-wk ( HF trial ) 710 ml per day HG-sweetened beverage ( sweeten 50 g glucose 15 g fructose ) 2-wk ( HG trial ) top normal diet . In addition , participant instruct maintain normal physical activity level trial ( measure accelerometer ) . On day 15 trial , participant report lab ~ 11 h overnight fast metabolic test . During test day , participant remain lab 12 h consume three liquid meal ( one meal every 4 h HF meal HF trial HG meal HG trial ) , blood sample take every 15 30 min throughout 12 h test day . During test , participant remain physically inactive ( < 3,000 step ) .
DOC.criteria: male female 1520 year age participate organize sport ( nonathletes ) history heart , lung , kidney , endocrine , gastrointestinal disease medication know alter glucose lipid metabolism normal fast blood glucose concentration ( < 100 mg/dL ) normal fast triglyceride concentration ( < 150 mg/dL ) average daily fructose consumption < 90th percentile age sex athlete type 1 diabetic type 2 diabetic consume high quantity fructose
